Hi Jan,

> Are you testing whether the client can actually reach the intend=
ed goal?

Yes, which means the business protocol is tested and the implemen=
tation is tested. Just like normal functional testing really.

[snip]

> Wh=
at I intended to ask was whether a RESTful service could ever produce a res=
ponse that could be considered 'wrong'.

Assuming the service implementatio=
n is correct (big assumption), all the media types are properly declared (s=
maller assumption) and that the service won't fail for other reasons (impla=
usible assumption!), then I agree: hypermedia corrals you towards an approp=
riate outcome.

> P.S. The implicit theme being 'a RESTful service can neve=
r send a wrong response because the client must expect to be sent anything'=
.

"anything" can only be taken in context. It will be constrained by the m=
edia types your service uses, any additional link relations you've added in=
, and the domain application protocol (DAP, or business protocol) that your=
 service supports. 

Jim
